A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Though the beginning plays as a bit unfocused an hammy\, The Last Jedi gets progressively stronger as it goes on and has an interestingly different take on Star Wars. The franchise seems to be moving beyond a simple good vs evil divide between light and dark and I think this is ultimately a good thing. TLJ also deliberately subverts expectations of payoffs to frankly not very interesting and tired mysteries of parentage and cannonical origins in a clear turn away from the more derivitive trilogy Abrams appeared to be setting up. I can see why the blurred distinction between good and evil and turn away from trope reveals would make some fans uncomfortable\, however\, but Star Wars needs to grow up a bit to survive and I think this is the right move.
